Name: Statuette of Isis and Horus
Description: Bronze image of a goddess, probably Isis breast-feeding her son Horus on her lap. She wears uraeus and horned sun-disk, and there is a tang beneath her foot-plinth for insertion into a pedestal. The missing throne and pedestal may have been in a different, more perishable material. Such bronze images of deities have been found in great numbers at shrines of Late Period and Ptolemaic date.
